member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.FindModules
member.summary: Build a list of all connected QuickUSB devices
member.returns: A string containing a NULL ('\0' or CHR(0)) delimited list of QuickUSB module names found by the library. The final entry is designated by two consecutive NULL characters. For example, after executing this function with one module connected, nameList will contain "QUSB-0\0\0". If there are two devices plugged in, nameList will contain "QUSB-0\0QUSB-1\0\0".

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.FindModules(System.Byte[]@)

member.returns: A string containing a NULL ('\0' or CHR(0)) delimited list of QuickUSB module names found by the library. The final entry is designated by two consecutive NULL characters. For example, after executing this function with one module connected, nameList will contain "QUSB-0\0\0". If there are two devices plugged in, nameList will contain "QUSB-0\0QUSB-1\0\0".

member.summary: Helper function to retrieve a reference to the managed data buffer associated with the specified IntPtr. This is typically used from within a completion routine to convert a BulkStream.Buffer IntPtr object back to a managed object when data buffers are automatically being pinned.

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.WriteDataAsync(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Write a block of data values to the high-speed parallel port using an asynchronous function call
member.param: The data to write. This data must be pinned (unable to be reloacted by the Garbage Collector) and must not be freed until the request has fully completed as indicated by a call to QuickUsb.AsyncWait.
The number of bytes to write
The transaction ID of the request. This ID is used with the QuickUsb.AsyncWait function to determine when the request has completed.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ReadDataAsync(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Read a block of data values from the high-speed parallel port using an asynchronous function call
member.param: The read data. This data must be pinned (unable to be reloacted by the Garbage Collector) and must not be freed until the request has fully completed as indicated by a call to QuickUsb.AsyncWait.
The number of bytes to read
The transaction ID of the request. This ID is used with the QuickUsb.AsyncWait function to determine when the request has completed.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.AsyncWait(System.UInt32@,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Wait for an asynchronous transfer to complete
member.param: The number of bytes written/read for the transactions. This function must be called until bytecount is not zero or until the transaction times out.
The transaction ID, as returned by a call to QuickUsb.WriteDataAsync or QuickUsb.ReadDataAsync.
If true, the function will check if the request has completed and return immediately. If false, the function will block until the request either completes or times out.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.AsyncWait(System.UInt32@,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wait for an asynchronous transfer to complete
member.param: The number of bytes written/read for the transactions. This function must be called until bytecount is not zero or until the transaction times out.
The transaction ID, as returned by a call to QuickUsb.WriteDataAsync or QuickUsb.ReadDataAsync.
If true, the function will check if the request has completed and return immediately. If false, the function will block until the request either completes or times out.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ReadPortDir(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Read the data direction of each data port bit for the specified port
member.param: The port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.

The data direction bit values. Each bit in data corresponds to data bits of the specified port. A data direction bit value of 0=input and 1=output (i.e. 0x03 means that bits 0 and 1 are outputs and bits 2-7 are inputs).
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.WritePortDir(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.Byte)
member.summary: Set the data direction of each data port bit for the specified port
member.param: The port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.

The data direction bit values. Each bit in data corresponds to data bits of the specified port. A data direction bit value of 0=input and 1=output (i.e. 0x03 means that bits 0 and 1 are outputs and bits 2-7 are inputs).
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkWait(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkStream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check if a asynchronous transaction (made with either QuickUsb.WriteBulkDataAsync or QuickUsb.ReadBulkDataAsync) has completed, or wait for the transaction to complete
member.param: The QuickUsbBulkStream object passed into the corresponding QuickUsb.WriteBulkDataAsync or QuickUsb.ReadBulkDataAsync function call. This object must not be able to be relocated by the Garbage Collector and must exist until the request completes.

If false, the function will block until the request completes and executes its completion routine (if any). If true, the function will check if the indicated request has already completed and executed its associated completion routine (if any) and return immediately.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkAbort(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkStream)
member.summary: Abort in-flight asynchronous requests without having to wait for them to timeout.
member.param: The QuickUsbBulkStream object passed into the corresponding QuickUsb.WriteBulkDataAsync or QuickUsb.ReadBulkDataAsync function call. This object must not be able to be relocated by the Garbage Collector and must exist until the request completes. Pass zero (0) to abort all pending asynchronous IO requests.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.SetNumAsyncThreads(System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Set the number of threads and the thread concurrency for the Asynchronous Data API.
member.param: A word indicating the number of threads to allocate for the Asynchronous API. If numThreads is zero, no threads are created and the Asynchronous API will be single-threaded. If numThreads is greater than zero, the Asynchronous API is multithreadedthe indicated number of threads will be created and dedicated to asynchronously processing completion routines. When multithreading, the recommended number of threads to maximize multithreading performance is equal to the number of processors/cores in the system times two.

A word indicating the number of threads that are allowed to execute completion routines simultaneously. Specify zero if numThreads is zero. When multithreading, the number of threads allowed to execute completion routines concurrently will be limited by the value of concurrency, which must be at least one. The recommended concurrency to maximize multithreading performance is equal to the total number of processors/cores in the system.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.GetNumAsyncThreads(System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Get the number of threads and the thread concurrency for the Asynchronous Data API.
member.param: A pointed to a word indicating the number of threads allocated for the Asynchronous API.
A pointer to a word indicating the number of threads that are allowed to execute completion routines simultaneously.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

The completion routine (callback function) that is called each time a buffer is filled with data.

member.summary: Start streaming data to a disk file from the QuickUSB device.
member.param: Path to the disk file to create. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten.
The number of data buffers to use.
The size of each buffer, in bytes.

The maximum number of data transfers to successfully complete. Once the maximum is reached, the stream is automatically paused. Each successful transfer equates to a single data buffer filling with 'bufferSize' bytes of data being written to disk. Specifying a value of zero indicates the stream should not automatically pause and instead continuously run until explicitly paused or stopped.
The ID of the stream.
Additional flags controlling the operation of this function.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.WriteBulkDataStartStreamFromFile(System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte@,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.StreamFlag)
member.summary: Start streaming data from the computer to the QuickUSB device.
member.param: Path to the disk file to read. The file must exist or the function call will fail.
The number of data buffers to use.
The size of each buffer, in bytes.

The maximum number of data transfers to successfully complete. Once the maximum is reached, the stream is automatically paused. Each successful transfer equates to a single data buffer filling with 'bufferSize' bytes of data being read from disk and written out QuickUSB. Specifying a value of zero indicates the stream should not automatically pause and instead continuously run until the entire contents of the file have been written out, or until the stream has been explicitly paused or stopped.
The ID of the stream.
Additional flags controlling the operation of this function.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.StopStream(System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stop a previously started read or write data stream.
member.param: The ID of the stream to process, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.

If false, this function will block until the stream has completely stopped and any remaining callbacks have been called. If true, the stream will be marked to shutdown and will return without blocking.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProcessStream(System.Byte,System.UInt32)
member.summary: For single-threaded streams, this function is called to process and re-issue completed requests.
member.param: The ID of the stream to process, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.

The number of milliseconds the caller is willing to wait until a data request on the indicated stream has completed and is processed. If no data request on the indicated stream has completed within the specified amount of time, the function will return unsuccessfully and a call to QuickUsbGetLastError will indicate the error QUICKUSB_ERROR_TIMEOUT. If milliseconds is zero, the function will process any requests that are completed or timeout immediately.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.PauseStream(System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pause the automatic re-issuing of data requests on a stream.
member.param: The ID of the stream to process, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.

If zero (or false), this function will block until the stream has paused and all in-process requests have completed. If non-zero (or true), the stream will be marked to enter the pause state and will return immediately without waiting for any in-process requests to complete.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ResumeStream(System.Byte)
member.summary: Resume the automatic re-issuing of data requests on a stream.
member.param: The ID of the stream to process, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.summary: Get the current status of a stream

The status of the stream
The last error (if any) reported by the stream
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.WriteFirmware(System.String,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Programming,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Write QuickUSB firmware to a device
member.param: The path and file name of the QuickUSB firmware (QUSB) file

Specify QuickUsb.PreserveCustomization to preserve customizations present in the current firmware, QuickUsb.PreserveDefaults to preserve default settings present in the current firmware, QuickUsb.PreserveGpif to preserve GPIF customizations, and/or QuickUsb.PreserveSerial to preserve the serial number. To specify a new serial number, pass QuickUsb.ProgramSerial bitwise or'ed (|) together with the new serial number (must be between 1 and 65535).

(Optional) A function to call during the programming process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the programming process takes place.
(Optional) A pointer to user data that is passed onto the callback function. Specify IntPtr.Zero to ignore.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.VerifyFirmware(System.String,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Verify that the firmware contained in the specified device matches that of the supplied firmware file
member.param: The path and file name of the QuickUSB firmware (QUSB) file

(Optional) A callback function to call during the verify process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the verify process takes place.
(Optional) A pointer to user data that is passed onto the callback function. Specify IntPtr.Zero to ignore.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.IdentifyEpcs(System.Byte,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsId@,System.UInt32@,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsFlags)
member.summary: Identify the EPCS device connected to the SPI bus on the specified nSS line
member.param: The nSS SPI line that the EPCS device is connected to (0-9)
The ID of the EPCS device
Outputs the ID of the EPCS device found. This will be one of EpcsId.Epcs1 (0x10), EpcsId.Epcs4 (0x12), EpcsId.Epcs16 (0x14), EpcsId.Epcs64 (0x16), or EpcsId.Unknown (0x00).

Additional flags. Specify EpcsFlags.IgnoreNCE (0x0001) to prevent the function from automatically asserting the nCE line of the FPGA at the beginning of the function are re-asserting is at the end of the function.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ConfigureEpcs(System.Byte,System.String,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsFlags,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Write the specified FPGA data file to the EPCS device
member.param: The nSS SPI line that the EPCS device is connected to (0-9)
The path and file name of the FPGA data file

Additional flags. Specify EpcsFlags.IgnoreNCE (0x0001) to prevent the function from automatically asserting the nCE line of the FPGA at the beginning of the function are re-asserting is at the end of the function. Specify EpcsFlags.SkipErase (0x0002) to prevent the bulk erase step prior to writing the device.

(Optional) A callback function to call during the verify process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the verify process takes place.
(Optional) A pointer to user data that is passed onto the callback function. Specify IntPtr.Zero to ignore.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.VerifyEpcs(System.Byte,System.String,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsFlags,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Verify that the data contained in the EPCS device matches that of the specified FPGA data file
member.param: The nSS SPI line that the EPCS device is connected to (0-9)
The path and file name of the FPGA data file

Additional flags. Specify EpcsFlags.IgnoreNCE (0x0001) to prevent the function from automatically asserting the nCE line of the FPGA at the beginning of the function are re-asserting is at the end of the function.

(Optional) A callback function to call during the verify process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the verify process takes place.
(Optional) A pointer to user data that is passed onto the callback function. Specify IntPtr.Zero to ignore.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EraseEpcs(System.Byte,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsFlags,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Perform the bulk erase action of the EPCS device to erase the entire device to 0xFF
member.param: The nSS SPI line that the EPCS device is connected to (0-9)

Additional flags controlling the operation of this function. Specify EpcsFlags.IgnoreNCE (0x0001) to prevent the function from automatically asserting the nCE line of the FPGA at the beginning of the function are re-asserting is at the end of the function.

(Optional) A callback function to call during the verify process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the verify process takes place.
(Optional) A pointer to user data that is passed onto the callback function. Specify IntPtr.Zero to ignore.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ResetStatistic(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Stat)
member.summary: Reset a given statistic. Reseting a statistic resets any associated byte counts and time indicaters used by the statistic.
member.param: The statistic to reset. Specify Stat.All to reset all statistics. You should reset all statistics before first attempting to read and statistics from QuickUSB.
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.GetStatistic(BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Stat,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.StatUnit,System.Single@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retreive a statistic in the specified unit
member.param: The statistic to retrieve
The unit to report the statistic in
The value of the reported statistic
Additional flags controlling the operation of this function
member.returns: True on success or false on failure. Get extended error information with QuickUsb.LastError().

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbFindModules(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Build a list of all QuickUSB modules connected to the host
member.param: A PCHAR that points to a buffer in which to store a of QuickUSB module names found by the library. Device names are of the form 'QUSB-XXX' where XXX is the device address (0-126) in decimal. 'nameList' must be large enough to contain all the device names + 1 character
A LONG containing the length of the nameList buffer in CHARs
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbOpen(System.IntPtr@,System.String)
member.summary: Open a QuickUSB device for use by the library
member.param: A PHANDLE that points to a HANDLE in which to place the new device ID. If successful, hDevice will contain the new HANDLE.

A PCHAR that points to a null-terminated CHAR array containing the name of the device. Device names are of the form 'QUSB-XXX' where XXX is the device address (0-126) in decimal. The device name should be parsed from the response from QuickUsbFindModules. For example, if two modules are connected, devName should contain 'QUSB-0' to select the first module, and devName should contain 'QUSB-1' to select the second module.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbOpenEx(System.IntPtr@,System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Open a QuickUSB device for use by the library
member.param: A PHANDLE that points to a HANDLE in which to place the new device ID. If successful, hDevice will contain the new HANDLE.

A PCHAR that points to a null-terminated CHAR array containing the name of the device. Device names are of the form 'QUSB-XXX' where XXX is the device address (0-126) in decimal. The device name should be parsed from the response from QuickUsbFindModules. For example, if two modules are connected, devName should contain 'QUSB-0' to select the first module, and devName should contain 'QUSB-1' to select the second module.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbReadCommand(System.IntPtr,System.UInt16,System.IntPtr,System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Read a block of command values from the high-speed parallel port using the QuickUSB module
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx

A WORD containing the address. This address is the starting value of the HSPP address bus. If address bit 14 is set (1), then the address bus will not be driven. If address bit 15 is set (1), then the address will not be incremented after each read.
A pointer to a buffer in which to place data read from the high-speed parallel port
A PWORD pointing to a WORD containing the number of bytes to read from the high-speed parallel port on input and the number of bytes read on return
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

A WORD containing the address. This address is the starting value of the HSPP address bus. If address bit 14 is set (1), then the address bus will not be driven. If address bit 15 is set (1), then the address will not be incremented after each write.
A pointer to a buffer containing the data to write to the high-speed parallel port
A WORD containing the number of bytes to write to the high-speed parallel port
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbReadPortDir(System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Read the data direction of each data port bit for the specified port
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
A BYTE containing the port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.

A PBYTE to a BYTE in which to place the data direction bit values. Each bit in data corresponds to data bits of the specified port. A data direction bit value of 0=input and 1=output (i.e. 0x03 means that bits 0 and 1 are outputs and bits 2-7 are inputs).
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbWritePortDir(System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.Byte)
member.summary: Set the data direction of each data port bit for the specified port
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
A BYTE containing the port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.
A byte that contains the data direction bit values. Each bit in data corresponds to data bits of the specified port. A data direction bit value of 0=input and 1=output.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbReadPort(System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.IntPtr,System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Read a series of bytes from the specified port
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
A BYTE containing the port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.
A pointer to an array of bytes in which to place the data. This buffer must be at least length? bytes long.
A pointer to the number of bytes to read from the port. The bytes are read sequentially. The maximum length is 64 bytes (Full/High Speed) or 1024 bytes (Super Speed).
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbWritePort(System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.Port,System.IntPtr,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Write a series of bytes to the specified port
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
A BYTE containing the port address. Ports are addressed 0 to 4 corresponding to port A-E.
A pointer to an array of bytes to send out the port. This buffer must be at least length? bytes long.
A pointer to the number of bytes to write to the port. The bytes are written sequentially. The maximum length is 64 bytes (Full/High Speed) or 1024 bytes (Super Speed).
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbAsyncWait(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Wait for an asynchronous transfer to complete
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx

An PULONG that returns the number of bytes that were transferred as a result of the asynchronous function call. If the asynchronous function call is still pending, "length" will be set to 0. This function must be called until length? is non-zero otherwise, the driver will not release its internal buffers, thus causing a memory leak and an eventual system crash (Blue Screen of Death). If the asynchronous function call has completed, the number of bytes requested will be stored in 'length' and all internal buffers will be released.
A BYTE transaction identifier returned by QuickUsbReadDataAsync or QuickUsbWriteDataAsync

A BYTE value. If non-zero, the driver will not wait the default timeout value for the transaction to complete. If zero, the driver will wait the default timeout period for the transaction to complete.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbReadBulkDataAsync(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkStreamCompletionRoutine,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Issue an asynchronous bulk data read request.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
The data buffer. This buffer must remain valid until the request completes.
The number of bytes to read.
A pointer to a user-allocated QBULKSTREAM variable used to store all the information about the request. This data must remain valid until the request completes.

The completion routine (callback function) to call when the request completes. If zero (0) or NULL is specified, then no completion routine is called at the completion of the transaction and QuickUsbBulkWait must be called to determine when the transaction has completed. When multithreading, this routine executes from another thread and multiple threads may execute this routine at the same time. When single-threaded (not multithreading), the QuickUsbBulkWait must be called to determine when the transaction has completed, which will then execute the completion routine.
A user pointer passed on to the completion routine used to associate user information with the request.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbWriteBulkDataAsync(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.BulkStreamCompletionRoutine,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Issue an asynchronous bulk data write request.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
The data buffer. This buffer must remain valid until the request completes.
The number of bytes to write.
A pointer to a user-allocated QBULKSTREAM variable used to store all the information about the request. This data must remain valid until the request completes.

The completion routine (callback function) to call when the request completes. If zero (0) or NULL is specified, then no completion routine is called at the completion of the transaction and QuickUsbBulkWait must be called to determine when the transaction has completed. When multithreading, this routine executes from another thread and multiple threads may execute this routine at the same time. When single-threaded (not multithreading), the QuickUsbBulkWait must be called to determine when the transaction has completed, which will then execute the completion routine.
A user pointer passed on to the completion routine used to associate user information with the request.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbBulkWait(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Byte)
member.summary: Determine if an asynchronous transaction has completed, wait for an asynchronous transaction to complete, or wait for all pending asynchronous transactions to complete.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx

A pointer to a user-allocated QBULKSTREAM variable that has been associated with a data transaction from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataAsync or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataAsync. If zero (0) or NULL is specified, then this function will wait until ALL pending requests complete and execute their completion routines.

If false or zero, this function will wait for the specified request to complete and execute its completion routine. If true or non-zero, this function will return immediately and indicate whether the specified transaction has completed (or all transactions if bulkStream is zero or NULL) by either returning true (1) or by returning zero (0) with a call to QuickUsbGetLastError indicating QUICKUSB_ERROR_NOT_COMPLETED.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbBulkAbort(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Abort in-flight asynchronous requests without having to wait for them to timeout.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx

A pointer to a user-allocated QBULKSTREAM variable that has been associated with a data transaction from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataAsync or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataAsync. Pass zero (0) to abort all pending asynchronous IO requests.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbSetNumAsyncThreads(System.IntPtr,System.UInt16,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Set the number of threads and the thread concurrency for the Asynchronous Data API.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx

A word indicating the number of threads to allocate for the Asynchronous API. If numThreads is zero, no threads are created and the Asynchronous API will be single- threaded. If numThreads is greater than zero, the Asynchronous API is multithreadedthe indicated number of threads will be created and dedicated to asynchronously processing completion routines. When multithreading, the recommended number of threads to maximize multithreading performance is equal to the number of processors/cores in the system times two.

A word indicating the number of threads that are allowed to execute completion routines simultaneously. Specify zero if numThreads is zero. When multithreading, the number of threads allowed to execute completion routines concurrently will be limited by the value of concurrency, which must be at least one. The recommended concurrency to maximize multithreading performance is equal to the total number of processors/cores in the system.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbGetNumAsyncThreads(System.IntPtr,System.UInt16@,System.UInt16@)

member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
A pointed to a word indicating the number of threads allocated for the Asynchronous API.
A pointer to a word indicating the number of threads that are allowed to execute completion routines simultaneously.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

The stream ID, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.

If zero (or false), this function will block until the stream has completely stopped and any remaining completion routines have executed. If non-zero (or true), the stream will be marked to shutdown and will return immediately without waiting for any remaining completion routines to execute.

The ID of the stream to process, as returned from a call to QuickUsbReadBulkDataStartStream or QuickUsbWriteBulkDataStartStream.

The number of milliseconds the caller is willing to wait until a data request on the indicated stream has completed and is processed. If no data request on the indicated stream has completed within the specified amount of time, the function will return unsuccessfully and a call to QuickUsbGetLastError will indicate the error QUICKUSB_ERROR_TIMEOUT. If milliseconds is zero, the function will process any requests that are completed or timeout immediately.

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbWriteFirmware(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.UInt32,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.ProgressDelegate,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Write QuickUSB firmware to a device.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
The path and file name of the QuickUSB firmware (QUSB) file.

Specify QUICKUSB_PRESERVE_CUSTOMIZATION to preserve customizations present in the current firmware, QUICKUSB_PRESERVE_DEFAULTS to preserve default settings present in the current firmware, QUICKUSB_PRESERVE_GPIF to preserve GPIF customizations, and/or QUICKUSB_PRESERVE_SERIAL to preserve the serial number. To specify a new serial number, pass QUICKUSB_PROGRAM_SERIAL bitwise ored (|) together with the new serial number (must be between 1 and 65535).

A pointer to a QPROGRESS_CALLBACK function which is called during the programming process to report the percentage completed. This may be used to perform background processes and GUI updates while the programming process takes place.
A PQVOID variable to store user data that is passed onto the callback function.
member.returns: A LONG that is either non-zero on success or zero (0) on failure

member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
The path and file name of the QuickUSB firmware (QUSB) file.

member.name: M:BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.NativeMethods.QuickUsbIdentifyEpcs(System.IntPtr,System.Byte,BitwiseSystems.QuickUsb.EpcsId@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Identify the EPCS device connected to the SPI bus on the specified nSS line.
member.param: A HANDLE that was returned from a call to QuickUsbOpen or QuickUsbOpenEx
The nSS SPI line that the EPCS device is connected to (0-9).

A pointer to QWORD used to store the ID of the EPCS found. This will be one of QUICKUSB_EPCS1_ID (0x10), QUICKUSB_EPCS4_ID (0x12), QUICKUSB_EPCS16_ID (0x14), QUICKUSB_EPCS64_ID (0x16), or QUICKUSB_EPCS_ID_UNKNOWN (0x00).

Additional flags controlling the operation of this function. Specify EpcsFlags.IgnoreNCE to prevent the function from automatically asserting the nCE line of the FPGA at the beginning of the function are de-asserting it at the end of the function.
